title: geth crashed with error "invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference"
body:
#### System information

Geth Version: 1.3.6
Protocol Versions: [63 62 61]
Go Version: go1.5.1
OS: linux Ubuntu14.04
#### Expected behaviour
#### Actual behaviour

I set up a private network with 4 geth nodes, one node crashed with error saying

I0518 15:42:58.128905    6956 blockchain.go:1220] [1463557378128899797] inserted block #2149 (0 TXs 0 G 0 UNCs) (9627ba0f...). Took 2.866448ms
I0518 15:42:58.128962    6956 blockchain.go:1251] imported 1 block(s) (0 queued 0 ignored) including 0 txs in 2.929771ms. #2149 [9627ba0f / 9627ba0f]
panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[signal 0xb code=0x1 addr=0x0 pc=0x595594]
#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

None.
#### Backtrace


It is very likely that this crash won't occur with geth 1.4. From the source file names it looks like you are using the PPA. Please update to geth 1.4.
Please do as @fjl suggested and open a new issue. Thanks!

Hi,

I get this error message when I am trying to set up an environment as Geth node:

**C:\Windows\system32>geth --datadir "C:\Windows\chaindata" --rpc --rpcapi "eth,we
b3,miner,admin,personal,net" --rpccorsdomain "*" --nodiscover --networkid 15**

**Fatal: Error starting protocol stack: listen tcp :30303: bind: Only one usage of
 each socket address (protocol/network address/port) is normally permitted.**

If I change the command to include another port other than 30303, I get the same error message as hievan.

**C:\Windows\system32>geth --datadir "C:\Windows\chaindata" --rpc --rpcapi "eth,we
b3,miner,admin,personal,net" --rpccorsdomain "*" --nodiscover --networkid 15 --p
ort 22222
INFO [05-12|16:22:13] Maximum peer count                       ETH=25 LES=0 tota
l=25
INFO [05-12|16:22:13] Starting peer-to-peer node               instance=Geth/v1.
8.7-stable-66432f38/windows-amd64/go1.10.1
INFO [05-12|16:22:13] Allocated cache and file handles         database=C:\\Wind
ows\\chaindata\\geth\\chaindata cache=768 handles=1024
INFO [05-12|16:22:13] Initialised chain configuration          config="{ChainID:
 42 Homestead: 1 DAO: <nil> DAOSupport: false EIP150: 2 EIP155: 3 EIP158: 3 Byza
ntium: 4 Constantinople: <nil> Engine: clique}"
INFO [05-12|16:22:13] Initialising Ethereum protocol           versions="[63 62]
" network=15
INFO [05-12|16:22:13] Loaded most recent local header          number=0 hash=f44
428.7e61f7 td=1
INFO [05-12|16:22:13] Loaded most recent local full block      number=0 hash=f44
428.7e61f7 td=1
INFO [05-12|16:22:14] Loaded most recent local fast block      number=0 hash=f44
428.7e61f7 td=1
INFO [05-12|16:22:14] Loaded local transaction journal         transactions=0 dr
opped=0
INFO [05-12|16:22:14] Regenerated local transaction journal    transactions=0 ac
counts=0
INFO [05-12|16:22:14] Starting P2P networking
INFO [05-12|16:22:14] RLPx listener up                         self="enode://c66
3aa3fbcbe073e57e920b308ea8edb476fb355158379268af46f74f0cb17158866ea0312df7848451
7ef58fe263921d62bf1a450a3d5d11a2226a17ca4d9e2@[::]:22222?discport=0"
INFO [05-12|16:22:14] Blockchain manager stopped
INFO [05-12|16:22:14] Stopping Ethereum protocol
panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[signal 0xc0000005 code=0x0 addr=0x0 pc=0xa72182]

goroutine 59 [running]:
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/eth/filters.(*EventSystem).eventLoop(0xc042059ec
0)
        C:/gopath/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/eth/filters/filter_system.
go:434 +0x2f2
created by github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/eth/filters.NewEventSystem
        C:/gopath/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/eth/filters/filter_system.
go:113 +0x10b**

Please bear in mind that I have enabled port 22222 on the firewall.
The O.S I am running the commands on is Windows 7 x64. 

I have also tried to force the system to choose a port for the node connectivity, but I get the same error message related to the memory address.

Can someone help me with this?
This also happens to me when using Geth 1.8.21, downgrade to 1.8.17 solves the issue.
